qf5x-hNMo1JbP0solKXN2A.text: This review would of have 3 stars if there wasn't a hair in our food. The food taste great but I would not order the meat meals unless you enjoy soy products. We ordered the orange chicken, hot and sour soup, beef sizzling plate and egg rolls. The soup and egg rolls were my favorite.   Their sister location VegeWay is by far my favorite vegan restaurant in the SW area! Who am I kidding it's really good but Wynn has better options. For the price, looking for fast, cheap, vegan food. It's the best!!!

M3fcPWsP3yMEobBMtvVJSA.text: Found this place through Yelp since there isn't n e vegan food on the strip but is so worth  the drive  awesome  sweet friendly service  very kind n explain the meanu and what in the food very clearly the food is OMG amazingly  yummi  we will come back for sure even if we from L.A.   chef kenny very nice n friendly himself  too very sweet ppl n customer  services  u must try if ever in Vegas is to die for I would give this place a 5 star++++++++ 100% yummi reasonable price n get u full  n the desserts  is OMG yummi too Peggy was our server very nice n sweet n mind feel like home n very welcome  right when I walk in the door  if u ever in Vegas n didn't try it u r really missing out on yummy food   food taste yummi smell yummy  look amazingly  good food freshly made at time of order n so is desserts

yJc7IA0m-JPBsftHLbR-ng.text: We had such high hopes after reading the reviews but were extremely disappointed , stopped in and order 2 lunch specials . General Tao Chicken and Tofu w veggies . Miso came out and was very weak , each bowl had one tiny piece of miso the size of half a dime , The chicken was All breading with a tiny fleck of chicken , the tofu was not crisp. Our spring roll app was inedible. I know they were lunch specials at only $8.50 but it should be the same as a dinner entree quality, because if it was we would have come back for dinner

4OhChCPRQhSEO4SlvgOLqQ.text: We loved this place so much that we went two days in a row!  Wonderful service, super friendly staff and outstanding food, made with care.  This is a truly special place.

GQ1hg9o7nHRRa1GSoPX1hA.text: Love the food here! We now live in the Las Vegas area and love this food.  The spicy eggplant is a must have to start the meal. This is a vegan restaurant that will satisfy you even if you are not vegan. We have brought non vegetarians to experience this wonderful food and they walked away happy and completely satisfied. We have tried a lot of the dishes and have not been dissatisfied yet.  I will continue to be a regular customer and would highly recommend.

4mrkN9mAJFbASzQi-8i0zQ.text: A Vegan heaven  Great dishes, amazing flavors If you're going Vegan and like Asian/Chinese type foods, this is the place  You won't be disappointed

4Mj9MzPUd8X-rzC5ENIppQ.text: Hands down one of the best vegan restaurants I've ever tried! Every plate we tried was amazingly delicious that even my omni family members couldn't believe it was vegan. I'll definitely be back here when I return to Vegas

JuQRoT2QV5a5r36L9Bv9VA.text: I came with Yelper Tien N for a late lunch and we ate family style.   Roti w/ curry - this was the least greasy, yet puffy roti I've had. We both sat there wondering how they got away with so little oil while making it crisp and still fluffy inside The yellow curry that came with was pretty decent as well.  Crispy Beef - this was hard to tell this was soy beef aside it from not having any kind of strong beefy flavor. They know how to fry up something crispy here as the sauce never made the crisp outside sog AT ALL and it was not a greasy dish either. I wish every Chinese restaurant knew the Veggie House secret.  5 Vegetable Delight - this was subtle, but solid vegetables. The sauce is a light soy and ginger and it had lotus root, mustard, mushrooms (black fungus and shiitake), snap peas, carrots and cashews.   We ate everything up but didn't feel overly stuffed or get that "itis" you get when you just eat some filling, fatty, salty stuff. Definitely not feel guilty food at all.   I'm glad there is a place like this around. My own caveat is for a place that is "Veggie House" there wasn't many JUST vegetable dishes there, but I digress. I'm just not keen on fake meats, but that beef was good.   Service here is pretty good. Checking on us and drinks were refilled and didn't stay empty very long which is much appreciated on a hot summer day.   Must come if you're vegetarian/ vegan , definitely worthy even if you're not. The uncommon meat substitutes are definitely a foodie adventure in their own right.

jGX3DD-kIkihr07iBPNqZQ.text: Wow, this place was phenomenally good. We had the vegan "honey walnut shrimp" and it was really tasty. Of course, like a lot of vegan food, the rich sauces kind of cover up the meat substitute, and I'm guessing it's even less healthy than regular honey walnut shrimp. But health isn't why I ordered it...  The staff is incredibly friendly and it felt very genuine. The chef came by randomly and asked us if we wanted to try a taro cake (?) he was working on (for free, just to see what we thought of it), and he seemed to just love making food and making people happy.

NLEYiqaVShH4Fp2_ffwgdQ.text: Some of best Asian food I've had and I'm not a vegetarian.   The crispy eggplant is the best fish I've had in a long time.  Tasted like a better general tsaos chicken.  Soooo good.  $2 pot of jasmine tea.  Delish.  Veggie chow fun a kid favorite in a light brown sauce.  This will be a must return every time I'm in Vegas.

wn5sEMS1xvt7r5oqLLDGKg.text: This place was ABSOLUTELY amazing. Coming from a non-vegan, i could eat here everyday and never feel like im missing meat. All of their "meat" is pretty much some magical version of tofu. It was so convincing it almost made my very vegan friend uncomfortable. The service was spectacular to say the least.  My friend and I got: a pot of decaf green tea- $1.50 Chow Mein- Comes with all "Meats" (beef, chicken, shrimp) didn't care for the texture of the shrimp too much, but the flavor wasn't bad. The most convincing of all of the tofu meats was the chicken. I truly could not tell the difference AT ALL. Usually i shy away from show mein since it is such a simple and basic noodle dish. I can confidently say that was not the case with this one. It was piping hot, full of sauce, and jam packed with flavor.  Crispy fried eggplant: OMG this was something else, man. This was one of the best dishes i've had in a long time. Our waitress says they call it "Chinese French Fries" and it is even better tasting than the picture. They're nice and crispy covered in a beautiful teriyaki style sauce. You wont want to stop eating these lemme tell ya. Cherry Chocolate Ice cream - yes VEGAN! You can tell how fresh this ice cream is after the first bite. You can see small inconsistencies in how they mix in the cherries (but i like that) SO YUMMY.  Vegan or not, TRY THIS PLACE OUT. If you like yummy delicious food, that is.

photos.caption: Photo of Veggie House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie sting rolls and yeah you guessed it, home made sweet and sour sauce.
Photo of Veggie House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You MUST get these. Crispy fried eggplant. Who said vegan food is healthy ;)
Photo of Veggie House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HOME MADE CHILI SAUCE. Very very yummy

lhgsu4ymjinoHZ21_r95kg.text: Wow.  Simply wow.    I'm wayyy too full to leave an in-depth review....  so excuse my laziness.  I loved the:  Orange chicken. Cajun fish. Tofu (if you like tofu) Fried Rice  And the rest I've yet to try.    Ironically, it's Best vegetarian food in Vegas recommended by my meat eating friends.    It won't disappoint!

YkHDJgF74jaaHKIAEugLOw.text: If I could get vegan meals like they do it at Veggie House, I will go full vegan. A must stop on your Vegas trip. A+

2JtriBZ5FyuhfXFtxvHQTg.text: My 3 stars are for the service, alone. We were very pleased with how attentive, friendly & helpful our servers were. The food on the other hand, was disappointing & pretty bland in our opinion. And I really wanted to love this place (being vegan & all). We still had a great time because the service was great. I don't mean to sound offensive - but I thought the servers were just adorable in their button up shirts & bow ties, they even use fresh table cloths which my chef bf really loved ;) Oh - & I thought it was so sweet how the male server "asked" if I wanted a straw rather than just giving me one. Huge points there for being eco-conscious!! I just personally think its a bit overpriced & overhyped for the food you're getting.   My veggie chick'n chow mein wasn't bad, but it wasn't great either. It was super greasy & only came with peppers for veggies. I was expecting more flavor (given that its chow mein), & also expected some "mixed" veggies, but it was more like a chinese lo mein. No biggie, but the "chickn" made it pretty bad. It was super rubbery & had this really bizarre taste that I find with a lot of meat alternatives. Just tasted like fake, processed, cooked rubber that I shouldn't be eating.Totally should've just stuck with tofu. If you're a picky vegan (like myself), who misses the taste of real chicken, you know EXACTLY what I'm talking about! Lol I guess I should have ordered the orange chicken, like the server recommended, but this is precisely why I'm always scared to order any "meat" alternatives.  The tom yum soup wasn't too bad, but again, pretty bleh other than the ginger they put on top of it (that was the only real flavor imo). And again, just peppers??? Seriously -  If I knew they just put peppers on everything I would have specified "no peppers" lol However - the shrimp was VERY impressive! Couldn't believe how similar it was to vegan shrimp!! My meat eating bf who despises vegan food was even eating it!! So bravoooo for the shrimp!!   The happy roll was ok, not spectacular but tasty enough to finish, although I certainly don't think it's worth the $8.25. The happy roll was probably my fav out of all 3 dishes.  Overall - I was very pleased with their service & the fact that the ENTIRE MENU is VEGAN! (Server's words). I think those two factors alone are hard to come by & make a place worth coming to. But, considering I'm an incredibly picky vegan that loves my savory dishes, & my bf is an incredibly picky meat eater, we'll probably be skipping this one in the future. Lol Thanks, Veggie House. We'll miss you. xo

photos.caption: Photo of Veggie House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This vegan shrimp is AMAZING
Photo of Veggie House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Meh&#34; Happy roll
Photo of Veggie House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super oily Chow Mein

WBjcmidKRKnHrQKB7wCDzw.text: I'm what you could call vegan-skeptical. I tried going vegetarian in high school and couldn't hack it. I dated someone who encouraged me to eat less meat, tried vegan cheese (amongst other things), and thought it was okay but couldn't stick with it or afford it.  Enter Veggie House. Any time I've looked up places to eat in my neighborhood, it shows up at the top. I've seen it listed at or near the top of "best in Vegas" restaurant roundups. After months of passing it by in favor of other places to try, I finally gave it a go this past weekend. With my expectations set so high, Veggie House couldn't possibly rise to the occasion. Right?  I'm happy to say I couldn't have been more wrong. Veggie House takes every preconceived notion one might hold about vegan food and demolishes it with unfussy, flat-out phenomenal cuisine. I tried the House Chow Fun with vegan chicken, beef, and shrimp, and while the beef didn't quite come all the way to tasting like the real thing, the chicken and shrimp were downright indistinguishable from their "real" counterparts. The gluten-free selection is impressive for a diet choice challenging for Celiacs and the prices aren't bad for a vegan restaurant.  Bottom line: Veggie House is as good as the reviews claim and I can't wait to return.

qe5QjTcefEjNJFY1uUdPfw.text: Veggie House serves vegan meat that is better than its meat counterparts. I've had friends who love flesh food, and are obsessed with Veggie House. I'll give you rundown on the top five G.O.A.T (greatest of all time) items on the menu.  1. General Tzo Chicken  2. Roti with Curry 3. Mongolian Beef/Beef & Broccoli (tie) 4. Strawberry Cheesecake  5. Hon Hon Shrimp  I really enjoy coming here with a large party because you get to dine under the little canopy tables. To me, it adds to the entire dining experience.   I've had my fair share of Chinese restaurants throughout the Las Vegas Valley, but Veggie House outshines them all. The entire staff is delightful - from the servers to the owner. They never disappoint regardless of if I dine in or place a carry out order.   Veggie House is so much more than just a meat parody. You will not be disappointed, and you'll question if you actually ordered vegan food.

gYMCqbsmLygRJQRwfaWuTQ.text: This is a really fun vegan place! The customer service was helpful. My boyfriend and I are trying to just go vegetarian. We had gotten the Kung pao beef - Combo fried rice- spicy eggplant. It was ALL delicious. The egg plant was delicious because it all really fresh and hot.  Once the eggplant cooled off the texture made it difficult for his non vegan to eat but other than that. The food was AMAZING and I'm coming back.

NDQd-To02hwBnB4SsNF5Aw.text: Am I a vegan? No but my daughter is and we went here to have some mother/daughter time.  Was it my first time trying vegan food? No but I do enjoy it from time to time.  As we walked in, we were greeted right away.... a big plus in my world. I'm all about great customer service. The waitress was very polite and escorted us to our table. The place was crowded, another big plus. There was a cute little waterfall display next to our table by the way which I really enjoyed looking at. I also like to mention I found a great deal on Groupon for this place... $20 worth of food for $11.... cha Ching! We ordered the spicy fish dish, the sizzling shrimp dish, And Japanese ramen. And of course your meal comes with either white rice or brown rice so we settled for the brown rice. And what is Chinese food without hot tea? The ramen was delicious. Miso based with lots of ramen and very tasty. The sizzling shrimp plate was full of shrimps and veggies. Simply delicious! The spicy fish dish I didn't quite enjoy as much because it had this tangy flavor which I didn't too much care for. My overall impression you ask? I liked it. It was very satisfying and I'd love to go back and try some other dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Veggie House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dragon roll

LHSu07u13pFx7O5HzuAQ8A.text: When we went to Vegas this year, one of our friends had started a vegan diet.  Seriously....we're in Vegas...I'm ready for gluttony.   But, as in Vegas, there's everything to eat under the sun.  We did a little Yelp search and found Veggie House.   The group of five of us begrudgingly went kicking and screaming at the whim of the one on the vegan diet.  We had NO idea what to expect......  We often go up Spring Mountain for good Asian cuisine.  We haven't been disappointed yet.   Veggie House was awesome!  It's located upstairs in a building full of other restaurants.   We went during lunch hour - not too busy, which translated to exceptional service.  We always had a full glass of water, plates cleared immediately as we finished and a full pot of tea for the table.  The service was friendly and superb.  We ordered a lot of dishes to be served family style.  As appetizers, we ordered house veggie soup, fried veggie dumplings, happy rolls and lettuce wraps.   Main dishes we tried Kung Pao V Chicken, Spicy Veggie Crispy Beef, Crispy Spicy Eggplant, Buddha Delight and Veggie Roast Pork.  The meal came with a selection of white or brown rice.  We chose brown.   All I can say is WOW!   The food was completely amazing with a depth of flavors.  You would never know that it was all vegan! 100% meatless!  How do they do it?!   They had the "meat" textures just right - right down to the grooves on the beef.  With every bite, we all looked at each other around the table in sheer bewilderment at how wonderfully savory the flavors and textures were.    Our vegan friend smiled from her plate and said:  "See, I told you so!"  We all looked at her and agreed.   Veggie House would be a great option for Lent!

photos.caption: Photo of Veggie House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our table selections

MgIrQeTfxPqBovGd-vHKOA.text: I usually give this place five stars because they are one of my favorite vegan restaurants, however, the food tasted quite bland today, like it wasn't prepared with the normal ingredients or they were trying to cut corners preparing the meal, so I'm not sure what was going on but it definitely tasted different than normal. I ordered the roti with curry, Kung Pao chicken, and the spring rolls. There is a huge lack of communication from staff. Four different people came up to us to figure out whether we were picking up an order for carry out, dining in, or if we were delivery drivers... They also took forever to make the food. I think I'm going to switch to Chef Kenny's, his food is very flavorful and I think it's quite a bit better. The customer service is also way better.

8DDmig5wIxZTolJ3kej5ug.text: I am visiting my boyfriend who has been here for the summer for work, and since I am Vegan I looked up as many places to try while I was here.  I live in LA where there are a lot of new vegan places but this restaurant is by far the BEST vegan food I've ever had.  If you are looking for comfort food or a great Chinese food meal, then come here!!  The quality of the food was amazing and my BF who eats meat frequently could not tell any differences in his dishes.  My only wish is that they would come to LA! I would eat there every day :)

-_EDUFagqPYqyqcojaJXAQ.text: Veggie House is located on the 2nd floor above the SF supermarket. It was pretty packed when we arrived on a Friday night but there was no wait luckily! We ordered the Thai Tea, Honey Walnut Shrimp, Crispy Beef, and Braised Tofu with Veggies.   - The Thai Tea was pretty good and unique with the soymilk added to it. Guess it's good for those who are lactose intolerant x)  - Honey Walnut Shrimp - I was pretty impressed that the shrimp actually tasted and had the texture like shrimp! I liked this dish a lot!  - Crispy Beef - probably my least favorite dish. It was just fried goodness but not much substance. The broccoli it came with was also a bit cold. - Braised Tofu with Vegetables - Braised Tofu has been my all time favorite dish ever since I was a kid so I was looking forward to eating this.  The tofu was cooked correctly and everything was very fresh. I think the flavor was a bit underwhelming for me though. Maybe I'm just too used to the amazing flavors of vegetarian food back at the temples in SoCal though.   The service was very welcoming and friendly! Although, there was an awkward moment where a server came up to our table and excitedly showed us a new fish dish and we thought he was going to give it to us for free. After he tempted us, he left to give it to another table.  It was too good to be True lol.   Overall, I thought Veggie House was decent but nothing out of this world like many of the reviews state. Each dish was about $11-13 so it wasn't super cheap either. But if you're interested about Vegan Chinese food, go for it!

photos.caption: Photo of Veggie House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tofu and Vegetables
Photo of Veggie House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Beef

DcQzzLQ3QCnTp-QUnj2Fqg.text: When you are a vegetarian craving Chinese cuisine, there is only one place to go! Veggie House has a large menu with all your favorites. The "chicken" lettuce wraps are great, the sauce is tangy and the lettuce is always fresh and crisp. I also love the crispy spicy eggplant and the orange "chicken" has the best texture and flavor- always satisfies my craving.   The atmosphere is lovely and serene, with plants and waterfalls throughout the dining area. They also have a great round table for large groups.   Highly recommend!

_MT9_JD2E14ebsDR7qyIvA.text: when I'm in Vegas, I always come here. Food is Amazing, service is always Excellent. Wish they open up one in Orange County. #1  Vegan Restaurant , Veggie House in Vegas. #2 is Mitasie in Huntington Beach.

DzbE7f9xMr5o7oZIIZTVOA.text: Last time I went to there lt is terrible. I ate a iron wirein the dish. I don't believe that. I asked them can I return the dish. They told me no. Because they already printed receipt. The waiter's attitude is particularly bad. Low price, poor service

BMKUp1_x7TY9eaNXfkAj8A.text: Still great! Delicious food and amazing service. Came in on a Sunday and they were pretty busy but we got our food fast and it was on point. ib8DpMXrvf6F1NK87rdNNg.text: The food was so awesome, and the service was great too!! I loved all of the vegan options!!  I got the orange "chicken",  it was crunchy and very flavorful.
